entry.tran: 遍布的；贯穿始终的；四处弥漫的
entry.def: Something, especially something bad, that is pervasive is present or felt throughout a place or thing.

example.ex: ...the pervasive influence of the army in national life...
example.tran: 在国民生活中军队的影响无处不在

example.ex: She lives with a pervasive sense of guilt.
example.tran: 她生活在深深的愧疚之中。

means.word_mean: 1. the quality of filling or spreading throughout;

sentences.sentence: "the pervasiveness of the odor of cabbage in tenement hallways"

auth_sentence.content: He draws his inspiration from the pervasiveness of cellphones all over the continent.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: He draws his inspiration from the pervasiveness of cellphones all over the continent.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: But today the velocity and pervasiveness of the media make the problem much worse.

auth_sentence.content: Yet the enduring pervasiveness of such songs will guarantee him iconic status to the grave.
